ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learn Spanish Basics, basic grammar, and words. I generally understood the structure of language.

Excellent beginner Spanish course! Prof. Zhang is super helpful, supportive of the students, and takes care to explain things so everyone is on the same page. Vocab, grammar, reading, some cultural studies, some writing/composition.
How to study and appreciate new culture and languages.
I learned how to speak, read and write basic Spanish and could probably communicate on a basic level in a Spanish-speaking country. I learned about the cultures of Spanish-speaking countries as well.

I developed the skill to learn a language proficiently by understanding which memorization techniques are best for my learning process. I also learned the knowledge of not just language, but the Spanish culture.
I developed basic spanish reading, writing, and speaking skills.
I got to explore the many different aspects of the spanish language! I was also able to grow closer to my own culture, and those around me! I am excited to learn more spanish in the future!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Course materials are so expensive. I think it is very discouraging for most of the students.

The small class size (capped at 15) is helpful, as you get more opportunities to engage directly with the professor and you get close as a class. Lots of work, but a lot of it is completion-graded and okay to keep up with if you have the time. The main weakness is that the textbook is super expensive. $150 just for the online textbook, and then a $10 novel and $35 for five 15-minute conversation sessions with a native Spanish speaker. So it's nearly $200 total, and that's if you're not buying the print textbook. This isn't the fault of the faculty/department at all, I just think since Yale has $42 billion, the institution could make it easier for their students to take Spanish classes, because knowledge of the language is a really good skill to have.

Moves very fast, could slow down and add a few review days. 
Strength is taking time to learn about the culture and having mutiple forms of projects.
I love the structure of the course but I think work on asynchronous days could be optional to make the course less stressful.
The course was interesting and comprehensive, but it moved very fast. It could be improved if there were days for review because without them I found it hard to remember and use all the content.

The strengths of this course were the lingua meetings and the projects, which helped my understanding of Spanish very much. One weakness of the course was that there was not enough grammar practice worksheets that I feel could have helped my understanding.
The strength of this course was that since everyone was starting a new language, I could actively engage in class without worrying about saying wrong answers!

The strengths are the amazing professors who are super eager to help us learn! I liked the way the course incorporated things like lingua meet, and daily exercises! However, this class is everyday and can get tiresome, especially if taken at the 9am slot.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes absolutely! We were lucky to have Prof. Zhang teaching us. I would definitely recommend forming a study group and working together as you learn.
Yes, if u want to learn spanish this was a very fun and fast paced way to learn.
Yes, Yijing was an excellent instructor so it made it a very engaging and interactive class.
Yes, it is interesting and very helpful, though definitely a significant amount of workload and effort.
I would recommend this course, I would just have the other student be aware of the high workload.
yes! The Spanish L1 course is well structured so that you get a good amount of practice every day but to the extent that it's not overwhelming.
Yes! I loved this class! It was so cool, to learn beyond the language, and learn about histories, etc.
